title: My Kentucky Derby Dessert Recipe
description: A richly-flavored single-crust pie has a buttery pecan and chocolate chip filling flavored with bourbon whiskey.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Desserts Specialty Dessert Recipes Liqueur Dessert Recipes My Kentucky Derby Dessert 4.1 (16) 14 Reviews 10 Photos Chocolate, nuts, brown sugar, bourbon...no special occasion needed for this decadent dessert. It's a family favorite and so easy. Serve with lightly-sweetened whipped cream, dairy whipped topping, or vanilla ice cream and warmed chocolate syrup. Submitted by LYNNINMA Published on June 18, 2020 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 10 10 10 10 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 55 mins Additional Time: 15 mins Total Time: 1 hr 25 mins Servings: 8 Yield: 1 9-inch pie Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 3 extra large eggs 2 tablespoons corn oil 1 tablespoon bourbon whiskey 1 teaspoon vanilla extract ¾ cup all-purpose flour ¾ cup white sugar ¾ cup packed light brown sugar 1 ⅛ cups butter, softened 1 ½ cups chopped toasted pecans 9 ounces semisweet chocolate chips 1 (9 inch) unbaked pie crust Directions Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Beat eggs in a large mixing bowl with an electric mixer on high speed until eggs are foamy, about 3 minutes; beat corn oil, bourbon whiskey, and vanilla extract into the eggs until just incorporated. Beat flour, white sugar, and light brown sugar into egg mixture until smoothly blended, then beat in butter. Gently stir pecans and chocolate chips into the filling. Fit the pie crust into a 9-inch pie dish and pour the filling into the crust. Bake in preheated oven until top is golden brown and a knife inserted halfway between the center and edge of the filling comes out clean, 55 to 60 minutes. Cool the pie on a wire rack for at least 15 minutes before serving. Serve warm or at room temperature. Cook's Note: You may need to watch after 35 minutes of baking; check if crust edge is browning too quickly. If so, cover with aluminum foil and continue baking until filling is set as directed above. I Made It Print 31 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of My Kentucky Derby Dessert 01 of 10 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 10 Photo by  MissySissyntx 03/13/2019 I loved this pie!!! I did have to make some changes out of necessity. I traded toasted coconut for nuts- cause we’re not “nutty” people. Then I used Smokin’ Scotch instead of bourbon, since that’s what I had on hand. This pie turned out beautiful and tasty!!! I will definitely make this again!!! 03 of 10 Photo by  Barb 07/22/2017 04 of 10 Photo by  Jerry Bias 12/11/2016 05 of 10 Photo by  Chelsea Whelpton 07/26/2015 06 of 10 Photo by  Becky Cooksley-Bell 11/15/2014 07 of 10 Photo by  JeniJeni 05/04/2012 I have been making this pie for 10 years now. I usually brown the butter but I do not use oil. This is the staple of our Annual Kentucky Derby Party each year and it is always a huge hit!! 08 of 10 Photo by  JeniJeni 05/04/2012 I have been making this pie for 10 years now. I usually brown the butter but I do not use oil. name: LYNNINMA
instructions: Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).;Beat eggs in a large mixing bowl with an electric mixer on high speed until eggs are foamy, about 3 minutes; beat corn oil, bourbon whiskey, and vanilla extract into the eggs until just incorporated.;Beat flour, white sugar, and light brown sugar into egg mixture until smoothly blended, then beat in butter.;Gently stir pecans and chocolate chips into the filling.;Fit the pie crust into a 9-inch pie dish and pour the filling into the crust.;Bake in preheated oven until top is golden brown and a knife inserted halfway between the center and edge of the filling comes out clean, 55 to 60 minutes.;Cool the pie on a wire rack for at least 15 minutes before serving. Serve warm or at room temperature.
